William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet

sentences.english: My uncle lived next door in a set-up my father likened to Faulkner.
sentences.chinese: 我叔叔住在被父亲称之为福克纳公司的隔壁。

sentences.english: She was the first one to open my eyes to Hemingway, Faulkner, and other literary giants.
sentences.chinese: 是她带我进入海明威和福克纳等文学巨匠的世界。

sentences.english: He is still the writer before whom everyone from Faulkner to Mailer has knelt.
sentences.chinese: 不管是福克纳还是梅勒，他依然是他们膜拜的对象。

sentences.english: At home Faulkner again moved from one job to the next.
sentences.chinese: 回到家乡，福克纳再次一份又一份地更换工作。

sentences.english: Part third, the root that Yuhua's acceptance about Faulkner's narrative art.
sentences.chinese: 余华对福克纳叙事艺术接受的根源。

sentences.english: Cowley agreed that Faulkner was an uneven writer.
sentences.chinese: 考利认为福克纳是一位深不可测的作家。

sentences.english: First, Faulkner's handling of time in his story is most noteworthy.
sentences.chinese: 首先，福克纳在他的故事时间的处理是最值得注意的。

sentences.english: Faulkner traces the history of the Compson family.
sentences.chinese: 福克纳追述了康普生家史。

sentences.english: Faulkner has managed successfully to show a panorama of the experience and consciousness of the whole Southern society.
sentences.chinese: 福克纳成功的表现了整个南方社会的历史意识。

sentences.english: Faulkner, who said he thought his brother obtained the sword in Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 他说，他觉得福克纳是在巴基斯坦拿到那把剑的。
